basic_info.description: My name is Abed and I'm a man of many talents - I'm a brilliant Computer Engineer, a savvy Electronic Engineer, and a fearless adventurer. I've designed and built some advanced gadgets that are useful to humanity. But don't let my confident exterior fool you - I've also had my fair share of setbacks and struggles. I've learned from those experiences and they've made me the person I am today. So if you're ready for some excitement and innovation, I'm your guy.

projects.title: Quadcopter Drone
projects.description: An Arduino Nano unmanned aerial vehicle with four rotors spinning clockwise, each with a servo motor and propeller. A photoresistor was also needed so that the drone operates during daylight only. This quadcopter drone can be remotely controlled by an android application.

projects.title: COVID-19 Smart Hat
projects.description: During the COVID-19 pandemic, I was committed to staying safe and helping others in any way I could. I realized that I could make a significant impact by ensuring that everyone followed the COVID-19 safety regulations. To accomplish this, I decided to leverage my expertise in microcontrollers and create something innovative. That's how I came up with Extremis 1.0 - a smart hat that alerts the user if they have a fever, reminds them to stay at least 6ft apart from others, and even prevents them from touching their face. With Extremis 1.0, I'm able to help keep myself and those around me safe during these uncertain times.

projects.title: Real-Time Chat App
projects.description: Arena is a real-time chat application. It offers a range of functionalities such as allowing users to create an account, set up an encrypted strong password, log in to their accounts, and communicate with other Arena users. Additionally, it has some exciting features, such as moving particles that can be enabled or disabled. Users can also change their name and profile picture. Arena enables users to create group chats and send messages to all the members of the group. They can edit group names and profile pictures as well. Finally, whenever a user receives a message, Arena sends a notification to alert them.
